event_text: m_c is scolded after sneaking out of camp.
m_c falls into a river, but is saved by r_c.
m_c accidentally trespasses onto o_c's territory.
m_c sneaks out of camp with r_c.

m_c and r_c were chatting about their day and the chores they finished when r_c mentioned {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} liked the smell of wild fruit. m_c decides to wear acc_plural on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt, hoping that r_c notices {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

m_c is nearly blindsided by r_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} into camp after a long training day, listening to the kit squeak about a type of feather. r_c leads m_c to the nursery, where {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} carefully put acc_plural in m_c's fur.

m_c, for the umpteenth time, hears r_c complaining about the dry rye stalks underneath {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/finish/finishes} cleaning the elders' den and got an idea. The next day, m_c adorns {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt with acc_plural.
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to see the sun rise.
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to see the moon rise.
m_c and r_c try to sneak out of camp, but are caught by their mentors.
m_c and r_c play in the fallen leaves outside of camp.
m_c and r_c play in the snow outside of camp.
m_c gets dared to hunt outside in the snow alone, and returns with acc_singular in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c disappears for a few days, then returns to camp with a acc_singular around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
m_c and r_c were practicing climbing when they found a nest of strange eggs.
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching.
m_c encourages r_c to play in the snow with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} during a patrol.
m_c gives r_c a acc_singular to make up for a bad fight between them.
m_c was seen racing along the border with {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} rival from o_c.
m_c was seen playing with a kittypet over the border.
m_c was seen taking food from a Twoleg!
m_c was seen speaking with someone from o_c.
m_c was seen speaking with a loner.
m_c was seen speaking with a rogue.
m_c was seen speaking with a kittypet.
m_c was seen chasing a rogue off of the territory.
m_c was seen chasing a loner off of the territory.
m_c was seen chasing a kittypet off of the territory.
m_c was caught sharing prey with a rogue, who was chased off by a patrol.
m_c was caught sharing prey with a kittypet, who was chased off by a patrol.
m_c was loitering around o_c's border, looking for a specific cat.
m_c was seen arguing, and borderline-fighting with, a cat from o_c.
m_c was seen arguing, and borderline-fighting with, a rogue.
m_c was seen arguing, and borderline-fighting with, a kittypet.
m_c was seen talking calmly to a loner, before both cats went their separate ways.
m_c was seen speaking calmly to a cat from o_c.
m_c was seen talking calmly to a loner, before both cats went their separate ways.
m_c was seen in a very serious conversation with a kittypet, who ran away when another patrol approached.
m_c is struggling to cope with the violence and chaos of war surrounding {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, finding it difficult to wake up in the morning due to the stress and strain of constant battle training.
m_c feels like {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} might be growing up too fast in the midst of war.
m_c received a present, acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c decides to pick something to adorn {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt as celebration.
r_c gives m_c something to adorn m_c as congratulations.
m_c was given acc_plural as a congratulations, r_c watches from the side with a jealous glint in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes.
m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.
r_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to give them to m_c.
m_c always seems to have acc_plural stuck in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur.
No matter how hard r_c tries, there's always something stuck in m_c's fur.
m_c found a mysterious acc_singular growing in the frost and decided to wear it.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step and a new flowery accessory!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty flower! m_c takes it and decorates {PRONOUN/m_c/self} with it, purring out a thank you.
m_c finds a cool stick near the edge of camp! m_c decides it's cool enough to keep around.

r_c finds a cool stick while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to carry it around.
Mysteriously, it seems like m_c has found a small pumpkin near camp. m_c decides to roll it around with them around camp.

r_c finds a weird little pumpkin while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} it back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to roll it around.
After a warm stroll in the leaf-broken sunlight, m_c comes back with moss in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} jaws. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} seem oddly possessive over it.

m_c and r_c decide to go on a warm, sunkissed stroll together to fetch some moss. m_c finds a specifically enamouring patch of moss, to r_c's amusement, and decides to bring it back home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head at the camp wall. Nobody's entirely sure why... until {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/pluck/plucks} a few ivy leaves off of the wall, and wear it with pride.

r_c finds a cool ivy-covered tree while on patrol! {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} a pair of pretty leaves back home to m_c, and tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} it's a gift! m_c accepts it happily, and decides to wear it.
m_c spots an oak tree dropping acorns, and decided to take and wear one.
After m_c gets bonked on the head by a towering oak tree's falling acorns, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decide to take and wear one out of pure spite.

In the cool autumn air, m_c and r_c go on a short stroll together... and it's not too long until an acorn thunks onto the back of m_c's head. At r_c's cackles at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} disgruntled, embarrassed face, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} decide to take the acorn and wear it out of pure spite.

m_c was playing with a big mossball earlier, reminiscent of their kittenhood days! Suddenly, they get a wonderful idea --- cover {PRONOUN/m_c/self} in moss to pretend that m_c is a mossball! r_c is aghast and horrified as they watch m_c roll around in muddy moss.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step... and with a new noodly, harmless friend!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little snake {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
r_c and m_c, on a walk together, stumble upon an acc_singular. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head, and decides to take it home! r_c is charmed by m_c's generosity.
m_c sneaks out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching. Seems like one of the birds decided to stick around m_c after they attempt to leave!
m_c grins toothily at a acc_singular that wandered into camp! Instead of diving toward it like anyone would expect a cat to do, m_c decides to befriend it with seeds and nuts.

r_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/hunch/hunches} down to watch a mouse nibble at a fat seed! m_c stops r_c before {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} pounce, and manages to.. befriend the mouse! r_c rolls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes, grumbling about wasted food.
m_c leaps up at a flying bug {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} found around camp, and catches it with grace! {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wear/wears} the acc_display proudly.
r_c mrrps at m_c, asking {PRONOUN/m_c/object} if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} wanted a pair of acc_singular that they found. m_c says yes, and thanks {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for the cool wings!
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a cute, slowly moving snail! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c coos at the little thing as m_c carries it home.
m_c finds a worm in camp on a rainy day! m_c decides to keep it.

r_c watches with exhausted eyes as m_c violently digs a hole off to the side of c_n camp, flinging dirt everywhere. m_c approaches less than a minute later, covered in dirt and with a long worm in their jaws. Mumbled, m_c asks if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can keep {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new friend. Exasperated, r_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/object} yes and to not dig holes in camp, and then tiredly walks over to clean up m_c's mess.
m_c seems to have found a strange bug, and has decided to keep it as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a strange bug, and calls m_c over to see it. Curiously enough, m_c has decided to keep it as a pet.
m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head idly at a bee flying around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head. It doesn't seem to want to sting {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, so m_c assumes it wants to be {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} friend!
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a bee! m_c claims it's {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new pet.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c calls from behind m_c, and m_c has to leap out of the way of a buzzing bee! m_c shifts to swipe at it... but r_c remarks that it seems oddly friendly. m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c seems to have spotted acc_plural, and has decided to snag one up as a pet.
r_c seems to have found a pack of acc_singular collecting near a bush, and calls m_c over to see the acc_plural. Curiously enough, m_c has decided to keep one as a pet.
m_c wanders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a fruity smelling acc_singular! m_c flaunts their new acc_singular with grace.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cool acc_singular bush {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to take and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a cherry tree {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot from a ways away! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to tread over and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.

m_c proudly shows off something that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been working on for the past new days -- a clean, pristine white bird skull. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} decide to wear it, and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} do so proudly.

Over the past few days, m_c has been searching bushes with vigor. On an early morning, m_c reveals that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} been braiding and weaving a bow made out of leaves for {PRONOUN/m_c/self}! m_c flaunts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} work proudly.
m_c received a present, two weaved leaves that form a cute green bow from r_c! m_c decides to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c received a present, gently weaved acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
